comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: There is a record of a fight between lightweight champ Benny Leonard and Young McGowan in Rutherford, NJ in August 1912. www.cyberboxingzone.com/boxing/bleonard.htm A match between Phil Bloom and McGowan "of Brooklyn" on 2/22/14 in Brooklyn. fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%205/Brooklyn%20NY%20Daily%20E... query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30E17FD355D13738... McGowan vs. Harry Pierce at the Gowanus (Brooklyn) Athletic Club, 2/14/14 fultonhistory.com/Newspapers%206/New%20York%20NY%20Tribun... Another list of his fights: www.fightsrec.com/young-mcgowan.html A record of an ebay auctions sheds more light: :AUTOGRAPH: Lightweight Young McGowan.... Active circa 1911 to 1916, McGowan, whose real name was Samuel Goldberg, included among his opponents Benny Leonard, Phil Bloom and Young Montreal...On a one page, May 1969, signed ("Samuel Goldberg") typewritten letter, on the stationary of the Veteran Boxers Association of New York, Inc. Ring No. 8, of which he was president, Goldberg writes a boxing collector that he is sending autographs and photos and an application for a book McGowan has authored Fighter In A Naphtha Ring." www.worthpoint.com/worthopedia/autograph-lightweight-youn...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for providing the links for your information artolog. We'll correct the transcription error and determine what information we will add to the record the next time we update.
